consistentCasing_description.message: `typescript-config/consistent-casing` checks if the property `forceConsistentCasingInFileNames` is enabled in the TypeScript configuration file (i.e `tsconfig.json`)

forceConsistentCasingInFileNames.description: Report message when the option 'forceConsistentCasingInFileNames' is not enabled
forceConsistentCasingInFileNames.message: The compiler option "forceConsistentCasingInFileNames" should be enabled to reduce issues when working with different OSes.

importHelpers_description.message: `typescript-config/import-helpers` checks if the property `importHelpers` is enabled in the TypeScript configuration file (i.e `tsconfig.json`) to reduce the output size.

importHelpers.description: Report message when the option 'importHelpers' is not enabled
importHelpers.message: The compiler option "importHelpers" should be enabled to reduce the output size.

isValid_description.message: `typescript-config/is-valid` warns against providing an invalid TypeScript configuration file `tsconfig.json`

noComments_description.message: `typescript-config/no-comments` checks if the property `removeComments` is enabled in the TypeScript configuration file (i.e `tsconfig.json`)

removeComments.description: Report message when 'removeComments' is not enabled
removeComments.message: The compiler option "removeComments" should be enabled to reduce the output size.

strict.description: Report message when 'strict' is not enabled
strict.message: The compiler option "strict" should be enabled to reduce type errors.

strict_description.message: `typescript-config/strict` checks if the property `strict` is enabled in the TypeScript configuration file (i.e `tsconfig.json`).

target_description.message: `typescript-config/target` warns against providing a `compilerOptions.target` in the TypeScript configuration file (i.e `tsconfig.json`) not optimized for the defined `browserslist` values.

target.description: Report message when the 'compilerOptions.target' is not configured correctly for the user target browsers
target.message: Based on your browser configuration your "compilerOptions.target" should be "$1". Current one is "$2"
